hero.heading: Our Key Programmes
hero.text: We focus on strategic interventions to improve the lives of marginalized communities and people with disabilities.

programs.title: Braille Production
programs.shortDescription: Transcription of HIV/AIDS information into braille booklets for visually impaired youth.

details.heading: Inclusive HIV/AIDS Education
details.text: Implemented with funding from the U.S. Embassy through PEPFAR, this project transcribes critical HIV/AIDS information into braille booklets to bridge information gaps for marginalized youth with and without disabilities.
objectives: Transcribe HIV/AIDS educational materials into braille.
Promote accessibility for visually impaired youth.

programs.title: COVID-19 Community Response
programs.shortDescription: Training and support for marginalized groups to prevent COVID-19 spread and improve livelihoods.

details.heading: Empowering Communities Amid COVID-19
details.text: Funded by the U.S. Embassy through PAS, this initiative trains relatives of persons with disabilities in mask-making, soap production, and sign language communication. It reached over 9,000 vulnerable people in Bangwe communities.
objectives: Train community members in COVID-19 preventive measures.
Provide livelihood skills to vulnerable groups.

programs.title: Flower, Shoes & Vases Production
programs.shortDescription: Economic empowerment for women and girls through training in production of shoes and flower vases.

details.heading: Economic Empowerment of Women
details.text: With funding from USAID through World Connect Malawi, 50 women and girls were trained in production of shoes and flower vases, enabling them to earn sustainable livelihoods.
objectives: Train women and girls in craft production.

programs.title: Soap Making Training
programs.shortDescription: Training communities in soap and face mask production to fight COVID-19.

details.heading: Community Hygiene & Safety
details.text: Supported by the U.S. Embassy and CDC guidance, this project trained communities in soap and mask production, improving hygiene and COVID-19 preparedness for 9,000 marginalized individuals.
objectives: Train communities in soap and mask production.

programs.title: Flower Vase Making
programs.shortDescription: Hands-on production project empowering women to produce flower vases for sale and income.

details.heading: Artisan Skills for Women
details.text: This initiative trains women in the production of flower vases, promoting entrepreneurship and sustainable income generation.
